page.title: 14LIFE IN RESPRYN PARISH
page.content: The{National Trust}owns many of the seven houses that form{Respryn Parish. Most of the people who live there are employed on the {Lanhydrock {Estate.}The length of time that people have lived in the area ranges from 30 to 84 years, but they have noticed very little building or modernisation work during that time. One of the villagers owns a {farm} of about 240 acres. His main activity is based on the 600 sheep that he keeps.He is involved during the year with lambing,dipping and shearing his sheep.The farmer also keeps about 50 cows that have to be milked twice daily,and several pigs that have to be cleaned regularly.He has numerous horses and dog to help with work around the farm. The farmer enjoys his life, but has to travel 3 miles to do his shopping.
